Wrapper Functions¶

Wrapper Functions

This script contains the methods which wrap the various methods provided by different libraries. These wrapper methods are written to facilitate future changes.

created by Jalil Ahmed.

src.WrapperFunctions.ceil(float_value)¶

Returns the ceil value of a float

Parameters

float_value (float) – Value whose ceil is to be returned

Returns

Ceil value of the float

Return type

int

src.WrapperFunctions.choose_random(input_list)¶

Choose a value from a list at random

Parameters

input_list (list) – A list of values

Returns

A single value from input list

Return type

int or float

src.WrapperFunctions.convert_color(image, gray_scale_toggle)¶

Convert the channels of images because CV2 library channels are BGR

Parameters

  • image (numpy.ndarray) – A numpy array of image with channel configuration BGR

  • gray_scale_toggle (Bool) – Toggle for grayscale output

Returns

A numpy array of image with channel configuration RGB or Gray

Return type

numpy.ndarray

src.WrapperFunctions.extract_patches(image, patch_size, num_patches)¶

Divide an image to patches

Parameters

  • image (numpy.ndarray) – Input image

  • patch_size (int) – Size of a patches

  • num_patches (int) – Number of patches to be extracted

Returns

A numpy array containing patches of the image

Return type

numpy.ndarray

src.WrapperFunctions.full(size, value)¶

Create a numpy array filled with a constant value

Parameters

  • size (tuple) – Size of numpy array

  • value (int) – Value to fill the numpy array

Returns

A numpy array

Return type

numpy.ndarray

src.WrapperFunctions.imread(image_path)¶

Read image from image path. This is a wrapper function of cv2.imread()

Parameters

image_path (str) – Path of the image

Returns

A numpy array of the image

Return type

numpy.ndarray

src.WrapperFunctions.make_array(input_list)¶

Convert a list to numpy array

Parameters

input_list (list) – A list

Returns

A numpy array

Return type

numpy.ndarray

src.WrapperFunctions.make_categorical(labels, num_classes)¶

One hot encode an array of prediction labels. It is wrapper function to the to_categorical function in keras

Parameters

  • labels (numpy.ndarray) – A numpy array of labels

  • num_classes (int) – Number of classes

Returns

One-hot encoded array of labels

Return type

numpy.ndarray

src.WrapperFunctions.rotate_array(input_array, rotation_angle)¶

A wrapper function of the scipy rotate function. This returns the array rotated with rotation angle at the default axis=1

Parameters

  • input_array (numpy.ndarray) – A numpy array

  • rotation_angle (int) – Angle by which to rotate the array

Returns

A numpy array

Return type

numpy.ndarray

src.WrapperFunctions.shuffle_data(images, labels)¶

Function to shuffle data i.e. images and labels. A wrapper function of sklearn.utils shuffle

Parameters

  • images (numpy.ndarray) – A numpy array of images

  • labels (numpy.ndarray) – A numpy array of labels

Returns

Shuffle images and labels

Return type

(numpy.ndarray, numpy.ndarray)

src.WrapperFunctions.split_data(images, labels, test_size)¶

To split the data set into train and test sets stratified with labels. This is a wrapper function to sklearn.model_selection.train_test_split

Parameters

  • images (numpy.ndarray) – Array of images

  • labels (numpy.ndarray) – Array of labels

  • test_size (float) – Size of the test set

Returns

Train and test split of samples and labels

Return type

(numpy.ndarray, numpy.ndarray, numpy.ndarray, numpy.ndarray)

src.WrapperFunctions.stack_vertical(input_tuple)¶

Vertically stack a tuple of numpy array

Parameters

input_tuple ((numpy.ndarray, numpy.ndarray)) – A tuple containing numpy arrays

Returns

A numpy array

Return type

numpy.ndarray

src.WrapperFunctions.zeros(size)¶

Return an numpy array with zeros of size

Parameters

size (tuple) – Size of numpy array

Returns

A numpy array with zeros

Return type

numpy.ndarray
